wxcadm module¶

class wxcadm.CPAPI(org: wxcadm.Org, access_token: str)¶

The CPAPI class handles API calls using the CP-API, which is the native API used by Webex Control Hub.

clear_global_vm_pin()¶
get_numbers()¶
reset_vm_pin(person: wxcadm.Person, pin: Optional[str] = None)¶
set_global_vm_pin(pin: str)¶

Set the Org-wide default VM PIN :param pin: The PIN to set as the global default :type pin: str

Returns

True is successful

Return type

bool

Raises

ValueError – Raised when the PIN value is rejected by Webex, usually because the PIN doesn’t comply with the security policy.

class wxcadm.Call(parent, id: str = '', address: str = '')¶

The Call class represents a call for a person. Since Webex supports calls in the Webex API as well as XSI API, the class supports both styles. When initialized, the parent instance is checked to see if it is a Person instance or an XSI instance. At the moment, the Webex API only supports user-scoped call control, so most of the development focus right now is the XSI API, which is more feature-rich

conference(address: str = '')¶

Starts a multi-party conference. If the call is already held and an attended transfer is in progress, meaning the user is already talking to the transfer-to user, this method will bridge the calls. :param address: The address (usually a phone number or extension) to conference to. Not needed

when the call is already part of an Attended Transfer

Returns

True if the conference is successful

Return type

bool

finish_transfer()¶

Complete an Attended Transfer. This method will only complete if a transfer(address, type=”attended”) has been done first. :returns: Whether or not the transfer completes :rtype: bool

hangup()¶

Hang up the call :returns: Whether the command was successful :rtype: bool

hold()¶

Place the call on hold :returns: Whether the hold command was successful :rtype: bool

id: str¶

The Call ID for this call

originate(address: str, comment: str = '')¶

Originate a call on behalf of the Person :param address: The address (usually a phone number) to originate the call to :type address: str :param comment: Text comment to attach to the call :type comment: str, optional

Returns

Whether the command was successful

Return type

bool

resume()¶

Resume a call that was placed on hold :returns: Whether the command was successful :rtype: bool

send_dtmf(dtmf: str)¶

Transmit DTMF tones outbound :param dtmf: The string of dtmf digits to send. Accepted digits 0-9, star, pound. A comma will pause

between digits (i.e. “23456#,123”)

Returns

True if the dtmf was sent successfully

Return type

bool

property status¶

The status of the call :returns: {

‘network_call_id’ (str): The unique identifier for the Network side of the call ‘personality’(str): The user’s personalty (Originator or Terminator) ‘state’ (str): The state of the call ‘remote_party’ (dict): {

‘address’ (str): The address of the remote party ‘call_type’ (str): The call type }

‘endpoint’ (dict): {

‘type’ (str): The type of endpoint in use ‘AoR’ (str): The Address of Record for the endpoint }

‘appearance’ (str): The Call Appearance number ‘start_time’ (str): The UNIX timestanp of the start of the call ‘answer_time’ (str): The UNIX timestamp when the call was answered ‘status_time’ (str): The UNIX timestamp of the status response }

Return type

dict

transfer(address: str, type: str = 'blind')¶

Transfer the call to the selected address.

Type of transfer can be controlled with type param. VM transfers will transfer the call directly to the voice mail of the address, even if the address is the user’s own address. Attended transfers require a subsequent call to finish_transfer() when the actual transfer should happen.

Parameters

  • address (str) – The address (usually a phone number or extension) to transfer the call to

  • type (str) – [‘blind’,’vm’,’attended’]: The type of transfer.

Returns

True if successful. False if unsuccessful

Return type

bool

class wxcadm.Org(name: str, id: str, parent: Optional[wxcadm.Webex] = None, people: bool = True, locations: bool = True, hunt_groups: bool = False, call_queues: bool = False, xsi: bool = False)¶
call_queues: list[wxcadm.CallQueue]¶

The Call Queues for this Org

create_person(email: str, location: str, licenses: Optional[list] = None, calling: bool = True, messaging: bool = True, meetings: bool = True, phone_number: Optional[str] = None, extension: Optional[str] = None, first_name: Optional[str] = None, last_name: Optional[str] = None, display_name: Optional[str] = None)¶

Create a new user in Webex.

Also creates a new Person instance for the created user.

Parameters

  • email (str) – The email address of the user

  • location (str) – The ID of the Location that the user is assigned to.

  • licenses (list, optional) – List of license IDs to assign to the user. Use this when the license IDs

  • dynamically (are known. To have the license IDs determined) –

  • calling (bool, optional) –

  • and (messaging) –

  • parameters. (meetings`) –

  • calling – BETA - Whether to assign Calling licenses to the user. Defaults to True.

  • messaging (bool, optional) – BETA - Whether to assign Messaging licenses to the user. Defaults to True.

  • meetings (bool, optional) – BETA - Whether to assign Messaging licenses to the user. Defaults to True.

  • phone_number (str, optional) – The phone number to assign to the user.

  • extension (str, optional) – The extension to assign to the user

  • first_name (str, optional) – The user’s first name. Defaults to empty string.

  • last_name (str, optional) – The users’ last name. Defaults to empty string.

  • display_name (str, optional) – The full name of the user as displayed in Webex. If first name and last name are passed without display_name, the display name will be the concatenation of first and last name.

Returns

The Person instance of the newly-created user.

Return type

Person

enable_vm_to_email(email: Optional[str] = None, push=True)¶
Change the Voicemail config to enable sending a copy of VMs to specified email address. If the email param

is not present, it will use the Person’s email address as the default.

Parameters

  • email (optional) – The email address to send VMs to.

  • push (optional) – Whether to immediately push the change to Webex. Defaults to True.

Returns

The Person.vm_config attribute

Return type

dict

get_call_recording()¶
get_caller_id()¶
get_calling_behavior()¶
get_dnd()¶
get_full_config()¶

Fetches all of the Webex Calling settings for the Person. Due to the number of API calls, this method is not performed automatically on Person init and should be called for each Person during any subsequent processing. If you are only interested in one of the features, calling that method directly can significantly improve the time to return data.

refresh_person(raw: bool = False)¶
Pull a fresh copy of the Person details from the Webex API and update the instance. Useful when changes

are made outside of the script or changes have been pushed and need to get updated info.

Parameters

raw (bool, optional) – Return the “raw” config from the as a dict. Useful when making changes to the user, because you have to send all of the values over again.

Returns

True if successful, False if not

Return type

bool

reset_vm_pin(pin: Optional[str] = None)¶

Resets the user’s voicemail PIN. If no PIN is provided, the reset command is sent, and assumes that a default PIN exists for the organization. Because of the operation of Webex, if a PIN is provided, the method will temporarily set the Org-wide PIN to the chosen PIN, then does the reset, then un-sets the Org default in Control Hub. *This can cause unintended consequences if a PIN is provided and the Org already has a default PIN because that PIN will be un-set at the end of this method.

Parameters

pin (str) – The new temporary PIN to set for the Person

roles: list¶

The roles assigned to this Person in Webex

set_calling_only()¶
Removes the Messaging and Meetings licenses, leaving only the Calling capability. **Note that this does not

work, and is just here for the future.**

Returns

The instance of this person with the updated values

Return type

Person

property spark_id¶
start_xsi()¶

Starts an XSI session for the Person

update_person(email=None, numbers=None, extension=None, location=None, display_name=None, first_name=None, last_name=None, roles=None, licenses=None)¶
Update the Person in Webex. Pass only the arguments that you want to change. Other attributes will be populated

with the existing values from the instance. Note: This allows changes directly to the instance attrs to be pushed to Webex. For example, changing Person.extension and then calling update_person() with no arguments will still push the extension change. This allows for a lot of flexibility if a method does not exist to change the desired value. It is also the method other methods use to push their changes to Webex.

Parameters

  • email (str) – The email address of the Person

  • numbers (list) – The list of number dicts (“type” and “value” keys)

  • extension (str) – The user’s extension

  • location (str) – The Location ID for the user. Note that this can’t actually be changed yet.

  • display_name (str) – The Display Name for the Person

  • first_name (str) – The Person’s first name

  • last_name (str) – The Person’s last name

  • roles (list) – List of Role IDs

  • licenses (list) – List of License IDs

Returns

True if successful. False if not.

Return type

bool

vm_config: dict¶

Dictionary of the VM config as returned by Webex API

wxc: bool¶

True if this is a Webex Calling User

xsi¶

Holds the XSI instance when created with the start_xsi() method.

The type of Workspace. Valid values are:

new_conference(calls: list = [], comment: str = '')¶

Crates a new Conference instance. A user can only have one Conference instance, so this will replace any previous Conference. At the moment, this should not be called directly and will be done dynamically by a Call.conference() :param calls: A list of Call IDs involved in this conference. A conference is always started with only

two Call IDs. Call IDs after the first two will be ignored.

Parameters

comment (str, optional) – An optional text comment for the conference

Returns

The instance of the Conference class

property profile¶

The XSI Profile for this Person

property registrations¶

The device registrations associated with this Person

property single_number_reach¶

The SNR (Office Anywhere) settings for this Person
